info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 12 at 10:20PM EST until further notice by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwestern Connecticut, including the following areas, Northern Litchfield and Southern Litchfield County. * WHEN...Through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to locally heavy rain resulting in 1 to 2 inches on saturated ground and running off into elevated rivers will likely result in some areas of flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
